bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Illness Sign of tou tong 頭痛① , headache, mainly affecting the forehead. Yi xue ru men 醫學入門 2: Substance Entry ge gen 葛根：甘，平。善解肌，陽明頭額痛乃宜 , “Sweet, balanced, good for relaxing the muscles, and suitable for yang brilliance [conduit] forehead pain ”. Tou feng 頭風 , head wind [162]

Alternative Names feng tou 風頭 , wind head; tou nao feng 頭腦風 , head and brain wind; tou mu feng 頭目風 , head and eye wind; pian zheng tou feng 偏 正頭風 , hemilateral and proper head wind; nao feng 腦風 , brain wind; shou feng 首 風 , head wind; lei tou feng 雷頭風 , thundering head wind. Pathological Condition of wind evil attacking the head followed by pain, or dizziness, or itching. Jin gui yao lue 金匱要略 : 頭風摩散方，大附子（一枚，炮） , 鹽（等分）。 右二味為散，沐 了，以方寸匕，已摩疢上，令藥力行 , “Recipe for a powder to be rubbed [on the head for curing] head wind . 1 large piece of fu zi , boiled; equal amount of salt. Prepare a powder of these two substances. Wash [the patient’s] hair and rub the amount of a spoon of the size of a square inch [into the head] above the location of the ailment. This will activate the strength of the medication”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 refers to numerous pathological conditions of head wind, such as tou feng tou tong 頭風頭痛 , head wind with headache; tou feng xuan yun 頭風眩運 , head wind with dizziness; tou feng bai xie 頭風白屑 , head wind with a white scaling .
